intro: Hesperis stelligera, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean and parts of Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its distinctive, spiky flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to coastal environments. Its flowers, which range in color from white to purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. Hesperis stelligera is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize coastal dunes.
